intro: Pericalymma megaphyllum, commonly known as the broad-leafed pericalymma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white or pink flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are broad and oval, often with a slightly waxy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or heathland environments.
